definition: 7th earthly branch: 11 a.m.-1 p.m., noon, 5th solar month (6th June-6th July), year of the Horse/ancient Chinese compass point: 180° (south)

sentences.english: Hu attended a luncheon hosted by the Queen later in the afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 中午，胡錦濤出席了英國女王舉行的午宴。

sentences.english: On the noon, President Hu attended the luncheon given by Najib in his honor.
sentences.chinese: 中午，胡錦濤出席納吉布總理舉行的午宴。

sentences.english: Shortly thereafter we arrived at the private club for lunch.
sentences.chinese: 很快，我們抵達了舉行午宴的私人會所。

sentences.english: Twenty persons were dining, among them Dolohov and Denisov.
sentences.chinese: 二十人左右出席午宴，其中包括多洛霍夫和傑尼索夫。

sentences.english: That included one on the night of the luncheon, at the Clintons' residence in Washington.
sentences.chinese: 其中一名則是在克林頓夫婦的華盛頓午宴上確認的。

sentences.english: On the noon of the same day, Hu attended a luncheon given in his honor by Socrates.
sentences.chinese: 中午，胡錦濤出席蘇格拉底總理舉行的午宴。

sentences.english: The presentation was to be made at a luncheon .
sentences.chinese: 授獎儀式在一個午宴上進行。

sentences.english: She had not the air of being about to accept an invitation to luncheon.
sentences.chinese: 她臉上沒有那種受邀準備參加午宴的神氣。

sentences.english: Actually, I need to go get ready for the ladies' luncheon.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，我得給女士們的午宴做準備。

definition: to entertain (for dinner)/to invite to dinner
to absent oneself from a meeting/to decline to attend
